answers.answer: Ultrasounds and doctor examninations can be up to a pound off.  Is your fundus measuring big too?

I am only 30wks, my husband is 6'4" and I am also 5'2".  I didn't pass my gestational diabetes test, so I am getting a ultrasound at 36 wks, to see if i have to have a C-Section.  This is my first baby, so I too am nervous.  A friend of mine just had a C-Section and now is batting a very bad infection in her incision, she has to wear a pump that sucks everything out, and may even have to have her surgery redone.  So i feel your pain.  I have also been told that babies on dh side run big, he was a preemie so no telling how big he would have been.  But my half sister was 10 lbs 11oz.  And I am pretty sure that my mom had diabetes but was never diagnosed, because she had them with my brother who was the baby right before my half-sister.  Good luck, I heard that C-section is better then natural, pain-wise.

My step mother is 4'11", she delivered a 10 pound baby and an 11 pound baby.  So size is not the main issue, it has to do with whether your pelvic opening is big enough for your baby.  Take your hubby with you to your apt, he will be a good visual aid as you explain your concerns.And a c-cestion is not the worst thing that can happen during childbirth.  I so understand you want to deliver vaginally and I hope that works out for you.Try not to borrow trouble from tomorrow.  Your baby will be here soon, focus on that!

I am only 5'2 and had larger babies (8 1/2lbs +)both vagianl with no epidural.  Yes, it depends on your insides more than the outside apperance.  It may help if you go to the chiropractor--it will keep your hips in line and help with the baby process--also helps in those last weeks to just make you feel better.  Their table adjust to fit the belly bump so don't worry about having to lie on your stomach--it actually feels nice to lay face down since you probably haven't done it in a while.  Good luck

I measured about a week ahead with my son, but he was so active, and kept flipping back and forth from breech to head down.  They thought he wouldn't be too big though since he was active and the u/s didn't show much for concern.  My son was 10 lbs. 3 oz.  and I'm short too.  They never knew till it was too late.  I had a tough recovery and tore through to my rectum, had to have it reconstructed.  I probably would have recovered better from a C-section, but the thought of one still scares me.  My friend just had her little one, another Dr. predicted 8 pounds and she had a little girl barely over 5 pounds.  It's hard to guess the size, I would just talk with your Dr., but you would be surprised at what you can handle.  I'm 32 weeks with baby #2 and this one has been measuring larger than my first did, we'll see.

My dh is also 6'6 I am 5'5,  I was also measuring large throuh my entire pg. I had an amnio done at 37 weeks to see if her lungs were mature and then they induced me to give  me a shot a vaginal birth.  I did end up having a c-section.  But it wasn't bad at all. Oh my little preemie was about 9lbs!   We also have a history on both sides of large babies

My fundus is measuring big too that is why I got the 3rd ultrasound.  He balloon at 7.5 months an the doctor wanted to see me weekly for about 3weeks.  I know many people have c sections and do fine.  But I am an RN and I have seen c section and I have heard stories, when it is personal it hits home.  I have issues with them taking out my uterus and placing it on my belly.  IT SCARES ME. I fear infection to.  I have taken care of people who have had c sections and vaginal births...I know vaginal birth is the way to go, recovery is so much quicker and healthier  with better outcomes overall.

I am right there with you.  I was just at ob's office.  I am currently 37 weeks and he is measuring 9 lbs 6 oz.  He's been gaining about 3/4-1lb per week since 32 weeks.  No diabetes or anything.  I do have big babies though so I'm not particularly shocked.  My ob says the ultrasounds have about a 10% error rate so he could be plus or minus 9 oz.  I know he's big though, I can definately tell that.  I'm pretty nervous.  Mostly about his head size.  My daughter was 9 lbs and her head was huge.  The body wasn't so bad, probably because her head destroyed everything else down there.  I've set up an induction date of the 24th which will put me at 39 weeks.  I'm definately nervous about needing a c-section though.Good luck, hopefuly your baby will slow down a bit.

My mom had 5 kids and her biggest at almost 10 lbs. was the easiest to  deliver, she thought bc the size of the baby helped dilate her and gravity pulling on a bigger baby... I have 5 too, and my experience bigger is faster and better, but my biggest wasnt anywhere near that at 8 lbs. 2 oz.

question: Anyone having a big baby?  I am 33 weeks and so far have had 3 ultrasound the last one last monday showing the baby at almost 5 lbs...he wants to do another one at 36 weeks.  I passed my gestational diabetes check with flying colors...but my husband is 6ft6 and I am 5ft2,  I kind of expected it to be a big baby, he was 12 lbs at birth (my husband).   My OB is okay I have no complaints except he has a busy practice and will tell me the same things over and over again at each visit.  Like my back pain...at first he addressed it then backed off (for 2 visits he gave me helpful sigestions and and wanted me on leave, then the next it was like our converations never happened) I finally went to my family doctor who put me on leave becasue of the increase of pain, numbness and baby size.  My fear is that I will have a c-section, I told him that is my fear but I kinda felt it went in one ear and out the other. I guess I shouldn't complain becasue he is doing a fourth ultrasound, but I have this fear he will sit on it until my 40th week and I will be forced into a C section becasue the baby will be to big.Anyone else have these fears or experinces...I hope this post isn't to vague.
title: Big baby, 4th ultrasound and fears of child birth
